unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop a high level of oral, written, and technical communication skills, with specialisation for the specific needs of the discipline area.
Think critically and make informed and logical judgments of the arguments of others to arrive at reasoned and meaningful arguments and positions, and formulate and apply ideas to new contexts.
Demonstrate the ability to apply accumulated knowledge and skills to make decisions in the context of professional practice and/or scholarship
Explain the various processes and methodologies that are integral to advanced research in the discipline area under investigation
Acquire a coherent and advanced knowledge of the principles and concepts within the discipline area chosen for this unit.

assessments.description: The assessment and teaching and learning tasks of this unit are determined by the 8000-level unit you are studying within this shell unit. Please view the 8000-level unit for these details. Your grade in this unit will reflect the grades you achieve on completion of all prescribed tasks in the 8000-level unit.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: FOHS7200 - Advanced Topics in Research in the Human Sciences 1
data.description: This is a shell unit designed to engage students with current research in Human Sciences by the completion of units of study at 8000-level that are not represented in the program of available 7000-level units. This unit forms part of the in-depth coursework provided in the first year of the MRes program. The candidate will acquire advanced disciplinary conceptual understanding as well as an awareness of how research is carried out in that disciplinary area. There will be an emphasis on both an understanding of advanced concepts as well as their application in research and/or professional environments.
